name: Mentone Hotel

reviews.text: Noisy Smelly Rude Staff Paint peeling off walls No ironing board
reviews.title: Yes, it's a dump

reviews.text: Perfect if you like scabby rooms and don't want to sleep.
reviews.title: Pleasanly Surprised - Recommended
A Dump!
reviews.text: My son and I spent six nights at the Mentone the last week of December 2006 through New Years Day. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews; however we were pleasantly surprised to find a clean, pleasant room with a functional bathroom. We had room 11 (at the top of the house!) and although we faced the street, the room was quiet. The twin room was not large, but wasn't tiny either. As mentioned previously, the linen was not brand new, but was definitely clean and the towels are indeed changed daily. The bathroom was tiny, but had plenty of hot water except one morning towards the end of our stay when the hotel was full. Other than a shaving outlet, there are none in the bathroom. The outlets are in the little alcove where the small TV sits. It would be nice if they placed a mirror there so you can actually see yourself while blow-drying your hair. There is no elevator, and the stairs can be quite steep, but I'm not in the best shape, and was able to manage them (slowly). Getting luggage to the top rooms is a challenge, but doable. The location is very central; easy walk to the British Museum, Kings Cross/St. Pancras train station. There is even a stop for one of the London bus tours nearby. The breakfasts were good and plentiful with something for everyone. I felt the area is very safe - we didn't see anything or anyone to be concerned about - even New Years Eve. On the whole, I would recommend this hotel; while the Mentone is not the Ritz, it is most definitely not a dump.

reviews.title: Mentone Hotel OK...
reviews.text: For the price, it's centrally located and the staff was pleasant but that is all I can say about it. My room was tiny (which i'm used to in london hotels) but FILTHY and very run down. There were cig burn holes in the bedspread! a DUMP.

My husband and I stayed at the Mentone for 4 nights in late Sept 2006, and the accomodations were fine; nothing more and nothing less. I did a bunch of research, and we settled on the Mentone due to favorable reviews, affordable rate, and location.
reviews.title: Very Basic But Well Located

likes.liked: — Quiet location, close to public transport, good breakfast
likes.disliked: — A bit rundown, stained (although clean) bedding, tiny bathroom with no fan

reviews.text: Free wi-fi, breakfast included. The showers run hot. Beds cleans. Staff helpful. Walking distance even with luggage from subway, or Euston/Kings Cross trains stations. Rooms are pretty much student dorm or cheap bedsit, but for the price it's be best in London. Can get cheaper than the hotel website, but even that price is great for the location and facilities. I've stayed there a few times and will stay there again.
reviews.title: can't go wrong for the price

likes.liked: — value for money in a city where hotels usual have zero value for money. Plus wi-fi that works. For free.
likes.disliked: — It's not a classy place. It just gives you what you need. Wake up calls no reliable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Mentone for 3 nights last weekend with my husband. I would never go back - the walls are paper thin and the noise in the hotel is dreadful. Our first room stank of smoke and was a bed and a half rather than a double, so we asked to be moved. The second room was only slightly better - there was no hand towel in the bathroom and nowwhere to fix the shower handle to, so it meant bathing all the time or trying to hold the shower handle. The bed was terrible - I could feel the springs in the mattress and the pillows were lumpy. The breakfast wasn't great either, and on weekdays they only serve until 9, 9.30 at the weekends. It definitely didn't seem like a 3 star hotel to me, and for £250 you should be able to get something better.
reviews.title: Don't go there!

reviews.text: My wife and I, together with our 3 boys, had a great time at the Mentone. We had two rooms, just off the main stairwell, through a firedoor, and as they were the only two rooms there, it was like having a suite. In the daytime we could wedge the doors open (they faced each other) so we could keep an eye on the kids whilst still retaining some privacy of our own. In the night time we could lock their door and relax in the knowledge that they were only just across the small "private" hallway. The breakfasts have been written about before and we can confirm a 10/10 score here. One criticism, is that there was no place to leave your bags once you had checked out. Not really their problem I suppose, but most places have somewhere secure to leave your stuff if your flight is later on in the day. All in all, The Mentone is great for tube links, fairly central and the neighbourhood seemed really safe - the 24 hour Tesco is good as well. Oh and if you use the hotel's transfer from the airport ask for the Polish guy Matthew, a great bloke!
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: Excellent location. Close to Euston, Kings Cross, and center, yet in a very quiet area.
reviews.title: Good, no complaints

reviews.text: For the ones who prefer public transport, the tube is at a stone's throw. We preferred walking :)
reviews.title: not 3* but not terrible

reviews.text: After staying at several hotels in London, I would say that rooms are not smaller than the average.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.disliked: — Ok, the stairs, but then never been a stairs person...

reviews.title: If you like a shower, stay clear of this hotel
reviews.text: There is no elevator, and stairs are a bit steep. This might represent problem to elder people.

reviews.title: Perfect place for a Business Trevaller

likes.liked: — WIFI access in room and central location

description: The Mentone Hotel is a bed and breakfast situated on beautiful Cartwright Gardens in the Bloomsbury area of Central London. The hotel has been owned and managed by the same family since 1972 and has long been a popular choice with tourists and business travelers due to its pleasant surroundings and convenient location. We are just a stone's throw away from The British Museum, University of London, The British Library, Oxford Street, Eurostar, the West End Theatre District, and the neighbouring areas of Soho, Holborn and Covent Garden.The hotel occupies three townhouses on a Georgian crescent and consists of five levels (lower ground floor, ground floor, first floor, second floor and third floor). The townhouses are Grade II listed and the hotel has no lifts (elevators). We are a non-smoking establishment.
